009package Ch07_Morphological_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.GuiTools;
018import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryClosing;
020import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryDilation;
021import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryErosion;
022import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryMorphologyFilter;
023import imagingbook.common.morphology.BinaryOpening;
024import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
025import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
026
027import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
028
029/**
030 * <p>
031 * ImageJ plugin implementing a binary morphology filter with an arbitrary structuring element that can be interactively
032 * specified by the user. See Sec. 7.2 of [1] for additional details. This plugin works on 8-bit grayscale images only.
033 * Zero-value pixels are considered background, all other pixels are foreground. Different to ImageJ's built-in
034 * morphological operators, this implementation does not incorporate the current display lookup-table (LUT).
035 * </p>
036 * <p>
037 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
038 * (2022).
039 * </p>
040 *
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2022/01/24
043 */
044public class Bin_Morphology_Free implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
045
046        private static enum OpType {
047                Dilate, Erode, Open, Close;
048        }
049
050        /** Operation type (dilation, erosion, opening, closing). */
051        private static OpType Operation = OpType.Dilate;
052        /** Width and height of the structuring element. */
053        private static final int Size = 7;
054        /** Display the structuring element as a binary image. */
055        private static boolean ShowStructuringElement = false;
056        
057        private static boolean[] StructuringElement = new boolean[Size * Size];
058        static { // initially set the center element
059                StructuringElement[(Size * Size) / 2] = true;
060        }
061
062        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
063        public Bin_Morphology_Free() {
064                if (noCurrentImage()) {
065                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.RhinoSmallInv);
066                }
067        }
068
069        ImagePlus im;
070
071        @Override
072        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
073                this.im = im;
074                return DOES_8G;
075        }
076
077        @Override
078        public void run(ImageProcessor orig) {
079                if (!runDialog()) {
080                        return;
081                }
082                
083                byte[][] H = makeStructureElement(StructuringElement);
084                ByteProcessor bp = (ByteProcessor) orig;
085                
086                BinaryMorphologyFilter filter = null;
087                switch(Operation) {
088                case Close:     
089                        filter = new BinaryClosing(H); break;
090                case Dilate:
091                        filter = new BinaryDilation(H); break;
092                case Erode:
093                        filter = new BinaryErosion(H); break;
094                case Open:
095                        filter = new BinaryOpening(H); break;
096                }
097                
098                filter.applyTo(bp);
099                
100                if (ShowStructuringElement) {
101                        ByteProcessor pH = IjUtils.toByteProcessor(H);
102                        pH.invertLut();
103                        pH.setMinAndMax(0, 1);
104                        ImagePlus iH = new ImagePlus("H", pH);
105                        iH.show();
106                        GuiTools.zoomExact(iH, 10);
107                }
108        }
109
110        private byte[][] makeStructureElement(boolean[] structure) {
111                byte[][] kernel = new byte[Size][Size];
112                int i = 0;
113                for (int v = 0; v < Size; v++) {
114                        for (int u = 0; u < Size; u++) {
115                                if (structure[i])
116                                        kernel[v][u] = 1;
117                                else
118                                        kernel[v][u] = 0;
119                                i++;
120                        }
121                }
122                return kernel;
123        }
124
125        private String[] makeFilterLabels() {
126                String[] labels = new String[Size * Size];
127                for (int i = 0; i < labels.length; i++) {
128                        labels[i] = " ";
129                }
130                return labels;
131        }
132
133        private boolean runDialog() {
134                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
135                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
136                if (im.isInvertedLut()) {
137                        gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
138                        gd.addMessage("Image has inverted LUT (0=white)!");
139                }
140
141                gd.addMessage("Structuring element\n(hot-spot at center):");
142                gd.addCheckboxGroup(Size, Size, makeFilterLabels(), StructuringElement);
143                gd.addEnumChoice("Operation", Operation);
144                gd.addCheckbox("Show structuring element", ShowStructuringElement);
145                gd.showDialog();
146                if (gd.wasCanceled())
147                        return false;
148
149                for (int i = 0; i < StructuringElement.length; i++) {
150                        StructuringElement[i] = gd.getNextBoolean();
151                }
152                Operation = gd.getNextEnumChoice(OpType.class);
153                ShowStructuringElement = gd.getNextBoolean();
154                return true;
155        }
156
157}
